meanings.definition: A person or thing that contaminates.
meanings.sent1: The contaminator spilled oil into the river.
meanings.sent2: The factory's waste pipe was the contaminator of the nearby water source.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon was the contaminator of the picnic food.
meanings.sent4: His negative attitude acted as a contaminator, spreading discontent among the team.
meanings.sent5: The contaminator, like a shadow, followed wherever pollution lurked.

meanings.definition: To make impure or unsuitable by contact or mixture with something unclean, bad, etc.
meanings.sent1: Please do not contaminator the clean water with dirt.
meanings.sent2: The virus can easily contaminator surfaces if proper hygiene is not maintained.
meanings.sent3: The prankster tried to contaminator the cookie jar with a fake spider.
meanings.sent4: Negative thoughts can contaminator your mind like a dark cloud.
meanings.sent5: The careless actions of the hiker could contaminator the pristine forest with litter.
